result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault)

1:16 PM Defendant Nicholas J. Ernst in court.  Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan Sr. in court for Nicholas J. Ernst.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Motion to modify bond. Atty Mulligan makes argument-requesting the defendant be able to spend a weekend with his grandmother. Court reviews file. Court speaks to defendant's grandmother. State makes argument re: bond modification. Court reviews file. State speaks to the court.
Court grants the request.

Defendant may reside at either John Lawson or Mary Ann Lawson's residence. 
Curfew is to stay in place. All other conditions are in full force and in effect.

02:00 PM Defendant, Nicholas J. Ernst appeared with Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State. Court calls case and appearances. Atty Mulligan states it will be a waiver.  Arraignment scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

As part of $10,000 signature bond. No contact with DMAS or DMAS' residence. No unsupervised contact with any minor females. May not possess any electronics that allow access to the internet. 01:00 PM Defendant Nicholas J. Ernst appeared by video means in custody in the Washburn County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Aaron B Marcoux appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Thomas O. Mulligan appeared by video means for Defendant Nicholas J. Ernst. Court calls case and appearances. Court reviews file-Atty Mulligan speaks re: motion to amend bond. Nothing further. Defendant's Uncle makes statement on behalf of the defendant.  State makes argument. Court speaks to the parties. Final argument from Atty Mulligan. Court amends bond to $1,250.00 cash.

Off record at 10:03am. Back on the record at 10:07. Atty Thomas O. Mulligan will be representing the defendant. Waived formal reading of the complaint. Set for preliminary hearing. records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel - Attorney Christian Ness

District Attorney Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Gabe Pollak appeared by video for the State Public Defender's office. Defendant Nicholas Ernst appeared by video in custody. Court calls case and appearances. The Court questions Atty Pollak. The Court finds probable cause. The Court questions the DE.  Atty Marcoux requests between $2500 and $5000 cash bond. No contact with DMAS or DMAS's residence. No contact with anyone under the age of 18.  Prohibition on any electronics that allow access to the internet. Atty Pollak argues for signature bond. The Court orderes $10,000 signature bond with $2500 Cash component. No contact with DMAS or DMAS' residence. No unsupervised contact with any minor females. May not possess any electronics that allow access to the internet. No controlled substances unless legally prescribed. Not to possess or consume alcohol. Bond hearing 02/14/22 @ 10AM.
